content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, there is lumber all over the apartment

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey-hey-hey. So what happened? A forest tick you off?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. Y’know how we’re always saying we need a place for the mail.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I started building one. But then I decided to take it to the next step.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re building a post office?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, an entertainment unit, with a mail cubby built right in. It’s a one day job, max.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (notices that Joey is wearing some really tight jeans) My word! Those are snug.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah. These are my old work pants, Sergio Valente’s.
(Chandler goes to his bedroom and opens the door. However, only the top half opens, and he trips into his bedroom over the bottom half.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Power saw kinda got away from me there.

content.description: Outside Central Perk, Phoebe is pacing back and forth waiting for someone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Any sign of your brother?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, but he’s always late.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I thought you only met him once?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I did. I think it sounds y’know big sistery, y’know, ‘Frank’s always late.’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well relax, he’ll be here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I know, I’m just nervous. Y’know it’s just y’know Mom’s dead, don’t talk to my sister, Grandma’s been sleeping a lot lately. It’s like the last desperate chance to have a family, y’know, kinda thing. You’re so sweet to wait with me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, actually Gunther sent me. You’re not allowed to have cups out here, it’s a thing. (takes her cup and goes back inside)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Does anyone else think David Copperfield is cute?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, but he told me, he thinks your a fox.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, Janice, likes him. In fact she likes him so much she put him on her freebie list.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Her what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, we have a deal, where we each get to pick five celebrities that we can sleep with, and the other one can’t get mad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, the heart of every healthy relationship. Honesty, respect, and sex with celebrities.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, Chandler, who’s on your list?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, Kim Basinger, Cindy Crawford, Halle Berry, Yasmine Bleeth, and ah, Jessica Rabbit.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now, you do realize that she’s a cartoon, and way out of your league?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know, I know, I just always wondered if I could get her eyes to pop out of her head.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Monica, who would yours be?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: First, I need a boyfriend, then I can have a list.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s just a game Mon. (makes a ‘Can-you-believe-her’ face to the rest of the gang.) Rach, how about you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I don’t know, I guess, Chris O’Donnel, John F. Kennedy, Jr., Daniel Day Lewis, Sting, and Parker Stevenson.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Spiderman?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hardy Boy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Peter Parker.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What about you honey, who would be on your list?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I-I-I, that kind of thing requires some serious thought. First, I’ll divide my perspective canidates into catergories…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What a geek!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Everbody this is Frank! This is my half-brother Frank.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh, hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is everybody. This is Ross.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: How are you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is Monica.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Whoa!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And this is Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Whoa!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m gonna get coffee.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hey, how do you guys get anything done?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We don’t, really.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, so, now, do you guys have a lot of big plans?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah! Yeah, no, we’re gonna connect, y’know bond, and everything.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah, I was thinking that maybe we could go down to Time Square and pick up some ninja stars. And, oh, um, my friend Larry, he wants me to take a picture of a hooker.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, we don’t really take advantage of living in the city.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is drilling a hole in the wall and the drill comes out the other side really close to Chandler’s head. Chandler then rushes out to talk to Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. Did I get ‘ya?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, you didn’t get me!! It’s an electric drill, you get me, you kill me!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Calm down, do you want this unit or not?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I do NOT want this unit!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, you should’ve told me that before, I’m not a mind reader. Hey, we’re out of beer. I’m going to Monica’s.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine! (goes into his room and slams the door, then he slams the bottom half of the door.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is entering

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! Where ‘ya headin’ in those pants? 1982?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh Monica, listen, I ah, I saw down at the hardware store, they got those designer tiles on sale. If you ever want to redo the bathroom floor.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why, what’s wrong with my bathroom floor?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nothing. It’s just old and dingy, that’s all.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I highly doubt that. (they both go to the bathroom)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah. If you ah, move your hamper, you see what color the tile used to be. (Monica gasps) Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t live like this! What are we gonna do? What are we gonna do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Relax. Here hold this (hands her his beer). This old stuff just comes right off. (he bends down to try and lift some tile right in the middle of the floor, in his tight pants.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s a little more than I wanted to see.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aw! Look at that, every inch of this stuff is glued down. It’d take forever to pry this up. You should ah, you should just leave it. (starts to walk away, but Monica grabs him)
content.parenthetical: manages to pry off only a small piece

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t leave it! You gouged a hole in my dingy floor.
(Joey places the toliet brush and holder over the hole, which is in the middle of the floor.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Eh! There you go.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know that’s nice, y’know we could put it back there after the surgeons remove it from your colon!

content.description: Phoebe’s, Frank and her, are sitting on the counh, watching TV

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, ew!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah I know what I wanted to ask you. Um, can you roll your tongue? Because I can, and my Mom couldn’t, and I thought y’know, I figured that was something I got from our Dad.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: What, wait, you mean like this? (does it)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, yeah. You can do it to. (tries to do it, but can’t)

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Your not doing it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh right, yeah okay, my Mom could, and I can’t. We don’t have that…

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: When’s your birthday?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Feburary 16th.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: I know a guy who’s the 18th.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, that’s close. When’s yours?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: October 25th.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s the same month as Halloween. So, um, what kinda things do you like to do at home?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Melt stuff.

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is working on his list

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I’ve got three of my five.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Three of your five, what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Celebrities I’m allowed to sleep with.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! You are giving this a lot of thought.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, it’s hard okay, I only have two spots left.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, so who do you got it narrowed down to?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, Elizabeth Hurely…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oooh-hoo, very attractive, forgiving.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Susan Sarandon.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eh, y’know what, she’s to political, she probably wouldn’t let you do it, unless you donated four cans of food first.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And!! Isabella Rosselini.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh-hoo. Very hot, very sexy. But ah, y’know she’s too international, y’know she’s never gonna be around.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, you gotta play the odds, pick somebody who’s gonna be in the country like all the time.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, ‘cause that’s why you won’t get Isabella Rosselini, geography.

content.description: Phoebe’s, Frank is melting a plastic spoon.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay so, by melting, you meant melting.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So is it like art?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah, you can melt art. Hey, can I use your phone?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, yeah sure. Why you wanna call your Mom?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: No, I wanna melt it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, well um, not right now. Y’know I’m just gonna go to bed, I think the fumes are giving me a headache.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: G’night, bro.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: G’night.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Here. (gives him a fire extinguisher) Y’know, just in case.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh, excellent. (starts to melt the fire extinguisher’s hose.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is eating breakfast with Monica while Frank is playing with num-chucks on the balcony

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What kind of karate is that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No kind. He just makes it up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So how’s it going with you guys?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So far, it kinda blows. I don’t know, I just thought y’know that he’d feel more like a brother y’know, like you and Ross, just like close and connected and…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh honey, we’re close now but you-you wouldn’t believe the years of-of nugies, and wedgies, and flying wedgies, and atomic wedgies, and…(Phoebe shakes her head like she doesn’t understand) That’s where the waistband actually goes over your head.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ah!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, we used to drive each other crazy playing the shadow game.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, how do you play the shadow game?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, how do you play the shadow game?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I just asked you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just asked you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t have time for this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, that is what the game is.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Which you just gave up really quickly.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Have you seen Joey?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, just this! (turns around and has a paint lid stuck to the back of his pants.) Y’know what it’s my fault really, because the couch is usually where we keep the varnish.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, does somebody wanna hand me one of those tiles.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s retiling my floor. (they both run to the bathroom)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yo!! Spackel boy! Get up!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ah-ah-ah, now you started this, you will finish it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He started mine first!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Build the unit Cinderelly, lay the tile Cinderelly.

content.description: Phoebe’s, Phoebe and Frank are watching TV.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Whoa! Big octopus.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. (phone rings and Phoebe answers it) ‘Hello. (listens) Oh my God, I totally forgot! (listens) Well can’t someone else do it. (listens) But, I have company. (listens) Yeah, no look, that’s all right I’ll come in.’ (hangs up phone) Um, Frank, I’m really sorry but I have to go to work. It’s-it’s one of my regulars and he’s insisting that I do ‘um.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hey, what kind of work do you do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! I’m a masseuse. I give people massages and stuff.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: You-you work at one of those massage parlors?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, y’know we don’t call it that, but yeah!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Wow! That’s wild! No, I had no idea.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All righty. I’ll be back in-in a little bit. Unless you wanna come with me?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: You mean like watch?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, you can get one yourself. It’ll be on the house! Y’know what are big sisters for?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Well, I don’t think this, y’know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, no, I wouldn’t do you myself, I mean that would be weird. Yeah, no, I’ll get one of the other girls to do it. Oh, this will be so much fun! Hey! Are you excited?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah! Hey, do Monica and Rachel work there?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s bathroom, Joey and Monica are admiring the new floor.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s beautiful! It’s like the first bathroom floor there ever was. (Chandler tries to go to the bathroom) Whoa! Are you going in there for?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What, like a number?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi! Bye! (runs to the bathroom)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I’m done with my choices, these are final. (holds up a little card)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, it’s about time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, very official.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, yeah, well y’know Chandler printed it up on his computer.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And who laminated it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That would be me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right let me see. (grabs the card) Uma Thurman, Winona Ryder, Elizabeth Hurely, Michelle Pfieffer, and Dorothy Hammel?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, it’s my list.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay honey, you do realize she only spins like that on ice.

content.description: Healing Hands Inc. (Phoebe’s work), Frank is being ushered in, by the arm, to the room Phoebe is in by another girl.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Ow!-Ow!-Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Y’know, ow!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!-Hey! What’s going on?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: She broke my arm.

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: He touched my fanny.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: No, she touched mine first!

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: That’s my job!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: So wait, what’s the deal here, I can have sex with you, but I can’t touch you?

content.speaker: Phoebe and Girl
content.text: Ewww!!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You can’t have sex with her!

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: What’d you think I was, a hooker?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: No, your a masseuse, it’s cool, I’m not a cop.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, Jasmine, can you, can you ask Mr. Whiffler if he can wait for like five minutes.

content.speaker: Jasmine
content.text: Fine. (starts to leave, and points at Frank) I don’t like you!! (leaves)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So that’s what you thought I did!! God! That’s not what I do!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Wait that’s-that’s, what that’s not what you do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nooo! Why would you think that?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: I don’t know, I mean, y’know, this is the city y’know, I just, I mean, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whatever, it’s the perfect end to the perfect weekend anyways.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh, wait, no your right, no it was perfect and I can’t believe that I screwed it up so bad.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You really thought it was perfect?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Well, no, maybe-maybe it wasn’t perfect, but y’know it was pretty cool, y’know, ‘cause we had all those great talks y’know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, um, which ones in particular were great for you?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Well y’know about the tongue thing, y’know, and how I told you about my likes and my dislikes…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t…

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: How-how I like to melt stuff, and how I dislike stuff that doesn’t melt.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Right, okay, um-mm.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah, y’know I feel like I can really talk to you ‘cause y’know you’re my sister, y’know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I guess I do, yeah.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Then I go feel your friend up and make you mad at me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I-I wasn’t hopping mad, y’know.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: You hopped a little bit. Yeah, I really sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. All right, this is my favourite part of the weekend, right now, this.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: This?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh come on we went, we went to Time Square, we found ninja stars, I almost got arm broken by a hooker…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She wasn’t a hooker.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Well, when I tell my friends about her she will be.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, everyone is there, helping to lift the entertainment center into place

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, on three. One…Two…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why don’t we just go on two.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why two?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Because it’s faster.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I coulda counted to three like four times without all this ‘two’ talk.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, but in the future…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay!! Okay!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Heavy thing, not getting lighter!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, one…two…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So we are going on two?

content.speaker: All
content.text: All right!! (they lift it into place, however there is one small problem, the unit is so long that it blocks some of both of their bedroom doors.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, good job Joe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, it’s big!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah-yeah, so big that it actually makes our doors look smaller!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe, my ruler’s wrong.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe all the rulers are wrong.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look it’s not that bad. So what, it blocks a little of your door, a little of my door.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, y’know what I got a better idea. How-how ‘bout it blocks none of mine door and a lot of yours? (throws his shoulder into the center to try and move it, but it doesn’t move.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, listen, before I forget that side is still wet.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is serving some guy coffee.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay sir, um-mm, let see if I got this right. Ah, so this is a half-caf, double tall, easy hazel nut, non-fat, no foam, with whip, extra hot latte, right? (the guy nods) Okay, great. (she starts to walk away and under her breath) You freak.
(Isabella Rosselini enters)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Isabella
content.text: Um, coffee to go, please.
(Ross recognises her and goes over to the couch, mouthing ‘Oh my God’

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Isabella Rosselini. (points to her)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you serious? (they all look) Oh my God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Damn! I can’t believe I took her off my list.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why? ‘Cause otherwise you’d go for it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, maybe.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-oh, you lie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What you don’t think I’d go up to her?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, it took you ten years to finally admit you liked me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well missy, you better be glad that list is laminated.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You know what honey, you go ahead, we’ll call her an alternate.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, hold my crawler.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, are you really gonna let him do this?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, he’s about to go hit on Isabella Rosselini. I’m just sorry we don’t got popcorn.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi! Hi, I’m Ross, you don’t know me, but I’m a big, big fan of yours. I mean, Blue Velvet , woo-oo hoo! Um, I was wondering if I could um, maybe buy you a cup of coffee? (Gunther hands her change) Or maybe reimburse you for that one?

content.speaker: Isabella
content.text: Aren’t you with that girl over there? (points at Rachel, who waves back)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, yeah, kinda. Um, but that’s okay, see we have an understanding, um, see we each have this list of five famous people, (gets his out) so I’m allowed to sleep with you. No, no, no, it’s flattery.

content.speaker: Isabella
content.text: I’m sorry. (starts to leave)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no, no, no, wait, wait, Isabella. Don’t, don’t just dismiss this so fast. I mean this is a once in a lifetime opportunity…

content.speaker: Isabella
content.text: Yeah, for you. Is that the list?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Um, yeah.

content.speaker: Isabella
content.text: May I see it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Um, no.

content.speaker: Isabella
content.text: Come on! (grabs the list)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But, okay.

content.speaker: Isabella
content.text: I’m not on the list!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Um, see, but that’s not the final draft.

content.speaker: Isabella
content.text: It’s laminated!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, um, okay see, you were, you were on the list but my friend, Chandler (Chandler waves) brought up the very good point that you are international, so I bumped you for Wynona Rider, local.

content.speaker: Isabella
content.text: Y’know it’s ironic…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Isabella
content.text: …because I have a list of five goofy coffee house guys and yesterday I bumped you for that guy over there. (points at a guy and leaves)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re just gonna be friends.
content.parenthetical: to the rest of the gang

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, they are admiring the entertainment center

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Umm?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I bet ‘ya ya I could fit in there. (points to a hole in the center)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ve got five bucks says you can’t.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Get out your checkbook, mister.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I think I have the cash.
(Joey successfully enters the entertainment center, and Chandler closes the door on Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You are dogged man! I totally fit!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, you got me. (picks up a 2x4 and puts it through the handles so that the doors won’t open) I’m out five big ones! (puts the money in the crack between the door and frame) Here you go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you. Cha-ching! (Chandler starts to leave) Oh, well hello Mr. Lincoln. Better luck next time buddy. (Chandler leaves and closes the door) And the drinks are on me!
